executive_summary: The public relations (PR) industry manages clients' image, publicizes products/services and communicates with stakeholders. It faced volatility due to consumer trends and corporate budgets. PR firms experienced revenue losses in 2019 and slow 2020 growth. Agencies are affected by public service campaigns and the business cycle. Higher consumer spending influences PR demand. Revenue grew at 2.4% CAGR to $20.4B in 2024 as profit reached 14%. The pandemic affected client industries, hurting PR demand except healthcare driven by COVID-19 info needs. PR expanded social media, data analytics for better campaigns.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Disrupts Demand for PR Companies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pandemic-induced corporate profit losses resulted in slower PR revenue growth. Some loss offset by new healthcare demand for COVID-19 info.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Switches in Social Media Usage Create Opportunities
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, political tensions led companies to align with cultural views via PR. PR manages crises/reputations in the era of rapid info spread. Clients reallocated from mass media to targeted social media.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demonstrating the Impact of PR Efforts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: PR prioritizes better measurement/analytics tools to quantify campaign ROI and show tangible results to clients.
PR benefits from social media, data analytics and CRM software to improve operations and effectiveness. CRM tracks client relationships/contacts. Data tailors campaigns to audiences.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: INDUSTRY EXPERIENCES CHANGES IN ITS STRUCTURE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Large firms have long-term major client contracts for stable revenue. Small agencies susceptible to downstream swings. More global integrated marketing/PR services as clients internationalize.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A POSITIVE ECONOMIC OUTLOOK SUPPORTS PR AGENCIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising corporate profits enable expanded marketing budgets and need for PR services. More businesses and new products/campaigns require PR support.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: UPCOMING MAJOR EVENTS WILL LIKELY CREATE STEADY DEMAND FOR PR SERVICES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US election years and 2026 FIFA World Cup hosting drive PR demand from candidates and event advertising/management.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: PR AGENCIES BENEFIT FROM FUTURE BEHAVIOR TRENDS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Online/social media campaigns grow in marketing budgets, needing PR for targeted web outreach. Consumers support brands aligning with their values, utilizing PR.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Service Integration Creates Opportunities for Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: PR integrates with marketing/advertising as strategic brand advisors for improved campaigns. Agencies become one-stop shops for integrated services.

industry_definition: Public relations (PR) agencies manage communications between an organization and public to promote favorable relationships and portray a desired image. This includes the general public, employees, investors, customers, analysts and stakeholders. Compared to advertising, PR aims for exposure through public interest and news coverage rather than paid ads to give legitimacy.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady barriers to entry level

key_trends: The widespread use of social media leads to an increase in the need for public relations agencies. Having the ability to create multiplatform campaigns often allows companies to reach a broader consumer pool.
Public relations firms aim to become a one-stop shop. The growth in popularity among integrated campaigns results in agencies offering a wider product portfolio.
Advertising expenditure increases due to a positive economic outlook
The COVID-19 pandemic led to higher demand for public relations services from healthcare companies
General public relations services continue to be the most popular product
Public relations agencies base operations in proximity to major clients
Access to a large talent pool lowers wage costs and improves operational efficiency
The industry is highly price competitive, particularly among smaller agencies
Competition is lower due to scaling capabilities
Major companies aim to improve their brand positioning
Consolidation trends are common across large agencies
Wage expenses are high and will continue growing
Profit is volatile as it follows various cycles

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retailers use public relations (PR) companies to offer strategic communications advice concerning campaigns, brand strategy and building a community following for retail products, often working alongside advertising campaigns.

Healthcare clients, including hospitals, pharmaceutical manufacturing and biotech companies and research laboratories, compete to establish trust between themselves and their customers by providing medically valuable and accurate information in a relevant context.

The automotive sector has benefited from high levels of innovation, particularly regarding electric cars and the implementation of artificial intelligence. Success for automotive manufacturers relies on their reputation for safety, design and use of the latest technology, with PR companies helping shape their reputation with potential buyers or current owners.

Nonprofit organizations often don't have the resources necessary for large advertising campaigns, resulting in less money to spend on PR services. These organizations lean on carefully planned messaging strategies designed by internal teams and PR firms, creating stable demand from the segment.

Telecommunications and IT companies promote new products and deals, using PR services to reach a specific target market. IT companies are growing wary of increasing public interest issues as consumers become more aware of internet privacy and neutrality.

The finance and banking sector uses PR firms to support investor relations and public affairs services. High levels of volatility create uncertainty among users and stakeholders, enhancing the importance of transparency and credibility, both of which PR agencies help with.

products_and_services.product_description: Public relations (PR) firms work alongside the marketing department to boost a company's brand and image. PR services improve the profile and image of a company, assist consumers' understanding of its products or services and inform shareholders of company activities.
Event management companies plan and facilitate special events and activities, marketing products through experiences and helping shape consumer perception of a brand's quality and identity.

Media relations services support the development of campaigns by conducting market research, analyzing the size of a potential audience and testing advertisements with focus groups for a particular ad campaign.

Public affairs services manage an organization's relationship with its stakeholders, including politicians, customers, local communities, clients, shareholders, trade associations, charities, business groups and the media. Companies and industry associations hire lobbying services to gain influence over legislation affecting the industry, either positively or negatively.
Other services PR agencies provide may include business-to-business communication, corporate communication, advertising campaign management, consulting, marketing and creative services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Competition is lower due to scaling capabilities
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Smaller companies face higher levels of competition due to the size of their projects, while larger companies compete with other international agencies.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Major companies aim to improve their brand positioning
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many companies have shared their stand on events like the COVID-19 pandemic and the Ukraine War, creating strong brand values.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Consolidation trends are common across large agencies
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Companies are looking to offer a wider pool of products by acquiring firms with these capabilities.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Wage expenses are high and will continue growing
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Public relations companies require employees to have a wide skill set, ranging from soft skills, such as client communication, to hard skills, including data analytics.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Profit is volatile as it follows various cycles
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Agencies face an uptake in demand during election years and falling revenue when corporate profit decreases.

business_locations.location_description: New York is a common location for large firms to base operations, mainly due to the easy access to the financial sector and historically significant advertising firms.
The District of Columbia (DC) is a suitable home for PR companies, as many politicians and nonprofit organizations based in the area rely on PR services to create a favorable public image.
California is home to the highest number of PR agencies in the West, as many significant markets are based in the area.
The Southeast is home to the most significant portion of the national population, providing access to a larger workforce and a higher number of companies.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Although public relations (PR) agencies are lightly regulated, they are affected by regulations for specific products. These regulations prevent marketing campaigns for harmful products, including tobacco and alcohol.
The FTC sets guidelines for advertising and PR agencies to protect consumers by requiring companies to provide disclosure statements if there is a possibility of consumer confusion.

PR firms must ensure that clients use trademarks and copyrights properly in media outlets. Similarly, PR agencies representing individuals must be knowledgeable in regard to libel and defamation laws.

barriers_points.barrier_description: PR agencies rely heavily on well-prepared and experienced workers. In some instances, workers are required to have a legal background.

basis_points.basis_description: The industry is highly price competitive, particularly among smaller agencies. Many agencies can offer similar results for the same price.
Competition is lower due to scaling capabilities. Smaller companies face higher levels of competition due to the size of their projects.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Large PR companies need to restructure to keep up with industry changes.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Office supplies and software constitute purchase costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs include market research, advertising space purchased for clients, and payments for any outsourced professional or technical services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PR agencies that don't have in-house market research services incur costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: PR agencies that don't have in-house market research services incur costs related to securing market research for clients and internal use.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: PR agencies rely heavily on well-prepared and experienced workers
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: PR agencies rely heavily on well-prepared and experienced workers. In some instances, workers are required to have a legal background.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The pandemic drove demand for general PR services
volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic drove demand for general PR services as companies needed support navigating the unique circumstances brought on by the pandemic.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Elections drive revenue from public affairs
volatility_points.volatility_description: Election years often lead to higher spending on PR services as political candidates look to reach a broad pool of voters while improving their public image.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: General public relations services bring in the most revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Public relations (PR) firms work alongside the marketing department to boost a company's brand and image.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry's largest cost component is wages, followed by marketing and rent expenditures.

FAQs.question: Has your company experienced increased demand stemming from political and social issues?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators have experienced increased demand for services regarding political and social issues.
